abstract: Study in journal Morbidity and Mortality Weekly Report finds several babies born in Brazil without overt signs of microcephaly, complication stemming from Zika virus, have developed condition later on; predicts future waves of disorders linked to virus.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: A study published Tuesday found that some babies who did not have unusually small heads when they were born still presented microcephaly months later.
snippet: A study published Tuesday found that some babies who did not have unusually small heads when they were born still presented microcephaly months later....

headline.main: Microcephaly Found in Babies of Zika-Infected Mothers Months After Birth
headline.print_headline: Zika-Related Microcephaly Is Found in Babies Months After Birth
